FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class CanvasElementManager

Namespace
FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering
Assembly
FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll

Coordinates rendering of all graph elements (nodes, ports, edges, handles). Acts as a facade over specialized visual managers for clean separation of concerns.

public class CanvasElementManager
Inheritance
object

Creates a new graph renderer with the specified settings.

Parameters

settings FlowCanvasSettings

Canvas settings. If null, default settings are used.

CanvasElementManager(FlowCanvasSettings?, NodeRendererRegistry?)

Creates a new graph renderer with the specified settings and node renderer registry.

public CanvasElementManager(FlowCanvasSettings? settings, NodeRendererRegistry? nodeRendererRegistry)

Parameters

settings FlowCanvasSettings

Canvas settings. If null, default settings are used.

nodeRendererRegistry NodeRendererRegistry

Registry for custom node renderers. If null, a default registry is created.

The node to edit.

Theme resources for styling.

Returns

bool

GetPortScreenPosition(Node, Port, bool)

Gets the port position in screen coordinates.

[Obsolete("Use GetPortViewportPosition or GetPortCanvasPosition instead.")]
public Point GetPortScreenPosition(Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)

Parameters

node Node

GetPortViewportPosition(Node, Port, bool)

Gets the port position in viewport coordinates.

public Point GetPortViewportPosition(Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)

Parameters

node Node
port Port
isOutput bool

Returns

Point

Remarks

WARNING: For distance calculations with pointer events, prefer using GetPortCanvasPosition(Node, Port, bool) since pointer events give canvas coords via e.GetPosition(MainCanvas).

RenderNodes(Canvas, Graph, ThemeResources, Action<Control, Node>)

Renders all nodes in the graph. Groups are rendered first (behind), then regular nodes. Nodes hidden by collapsed groups are not rendered.

public void RenderNodes(Canvas canvas, Graph graph, ThemeResources theme, Action<Control, Node> onNodeCreated)

UpdateAllPortStates(Graph, ThemeResources)

Updates the visual state of all ports in the graph based on their connection status. This should be called after rendering to ensure animated ports start their animations.

public void UpdateAllPortStates(Graph graph, ThemeResources theme)
